characters.name: Phoenix Wright
characters.description1: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.

characters.name: Trucy Wright
characters.description1: Future star magician, and Phoenix Wright's daughter. Fond of her Mr. Hat trick.

characters.name: Klavier Gavin
characters.description1: Star prosecutor and leader/vocalist for the rock group, the Gavinners.

characters.name: LeTouse
characters.description1: Lamiroir's interpreter. His first name is "Romein".
characters.description2: Shot during the performance. He died after leaving me with his last words.
characters.description3: Victim in this case, actually an undercover Interpol agent.

characters.name: Lamiroir
characters.description1: Singer lauded as the "Siren of the Ballad", from the tiny country of Borginia.
characters.description2: Famed singer from Borginia. Hid the fact that she is blind.

characters.name: Machi Tobaye
characters.description1: Lamiroir's favorite pianist. He is blind.
characters.description2: Blind pianist. Arrested on suspicion of having shot Mr. LeTouse.
characters.description3: Defendant in this case. Concealed the fact that he could actually see.
characters.description4: Defendant in this case. Turns out he isn't blind and can understand English.

characters.name: Ema Skye
characters.description1: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.

characters.name: Daryan Crescend
characters.description1: Guitarist for the Gavinners. His day job is as a detective in Criminal Affairs, Div. 3.

characters.name: Valant Gramarye
characters.description1: Famous magician, often on TV. Fond of exaggeration.
characters.description2: A famous magician, responsible for the illusion used in the concert.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

evidences.name: Postcard
evidences.description1: Lamiroir's own publicity postcard. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Lyrics Sheet
evidences.description1: Contains the lyrics to Lamiroir's ballad. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Investigation Request
evidences.description1: Information concerning the crime to be restricted to police and related parties.

evidences.name: Brooch
evidences.description1: Found at the crime scene. Seems strangely familiar...
evidences.description2: Found at the crime scene. Turns out it belongs to Lamiroir.

evidences.name: Revolver
evidences.description1: The murder weapon.  A deadly, high-caliber revolver.
evidences.description2: The murder weapon. A deadly, high-caliber revolver belonging to Mr. LeTouse.

evidences.name: Key Ring
evidences.description1: Mr. LeTouse died clutching this. Note the heart-shaped ring.
evidences.description2: Found in the victim's left hand. Holds keys to a guitar case and a motorcycle.

evidences.name: Mixing Board
evidences.description1: Allows music to be played in separate tracks. Click here to use.

evidences.name: LeTouse's Autopsy Report
evidences.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Prosecutor Gavin.
evidences.description1: Death due to loss of blood from a gunshot wound. Est. time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.

evidences.name: Crime Photo
evidences.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Prosecutor Gavin.
evidences.description1: Victim shot in shoulder in Lamiroir's room. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Diagram
evidences.obtained: Submitted as evidence by Prosecutor Gavin.
evidences.description1: The crime scene was Lamiroir's dressing room. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Video Tape
evidences.description1: Taped recording of Lamiroir's performance. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Headset
evidences.description1: Retrieved from Backstage Hallway. Receiver/transmitter for voice signals. All concert staff wore one.
evidences.description2: Receiver/transmitter for voice signals with a 30-foot range. All concert staff wore one.

evidences.name: Switch → Remote Trigger
evidences.description1: Found on the stage. It's a switch for something, and that's about all I know.
evidences.description2: Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter. Use with caution.
evidences.description3: Found on the stage. Triggers an igniter within 30 feet.

evidences.name: Forum Diagram
evidences.description1: Cross-section diagram of the Sunshine Coliseum. Click here for details.

evidences.name: Igniter
evidences.description1: Found at the crime scene. Emits a flame when triggered by remote control.
evidences.description2: Identical igniters in Gavin's guitar and at the crime scene. Triggered by "Remote Trigger".

evidences.name: Borginian Newspaper
evidences.description1: Article about the case. It doesn't mention the lyrics of Lamiroir's ballad.

evidences.name: Prosecutor Gavin's Guitar
evidences.description1: A gift from Lamiroir, sent from Borginia. Burned the night of the concert.

evidences.name: Replica
evidences.description1: Replica of something, held by Mr. LeTouse. Apparently the focus of his investigation.
evidences.description2: Borginia Cocoon replica, held by Mr. LeTouse.
evidences.description3: Replica of a cocoon from which a remedy for "incuritis" may be extracted.

evidences.name: Newspaper Article
evidences.description1: Article about the Chief Justice's son, who is inflicted with "incuritis".

evidences.name: Burnt Fragments
evidences.description1: Found at the crime scene, bearing a gunpowder residue. Possibly a firecracker?
